comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: These two young ladies are presumably dressing up as servants for some, probably amateur, theatrical activity. I've had no luck tracking down Bertha Raymond, but a Katharine Fitch was a bridesmaid to a Beatrice Raymond on June 2, 1914. See NYT from the next day: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D05E0DB1F39E633A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Here's another picture of Beatrice Raymond (Mrs. Ernest R Hudson): www.corbisimages.com/Enlargement/BE034495.html Could be the same woman, but not a sure thing.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Could this be another tableau photo from the New York Beaux Arts Society's pageants at the Hotel Astor -- used here by Bain to announce Bertha Raymond's forthcoming wedding?

A photo from the Venetian Pageant, in February, 1914:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4865583415/]

comment._content: It's definitely at the same spot as
